content: How can I help you today?

I've been having trouble sleeping lately, and it's starting to really weigh on me. My partner thought it would be a good idea to talk to someone, so I’m here. Not sure how much this will actually help, though.

Thank you for sharing that. Trouble sleeping can be really hard to deal with, especially when it starts affecting other parts of your life. It’s great that you’re here and willing to explore this. When you think about your sleep issues, what do you feel most stuck on?

Honestly, it’s probably the stress from work. I’m constantly worried about getting fired, and it feels like there’s this never-ending pressure to perform. At night, my mind just won’t stop racing, and it’s hard to shut it off.

That sounds really overwhelming—carrying that fear of losing your job and the constant weight of needing to perform well. It's no wonder your mind feels so busy when it's time to rest. How have you been managing that stress so far?
Mostly, I just end up scrolling on my phone to distract myself. I know it doesn’t help—it probably just makes it worse—but it feels like the only thing I can do to take my mind off everything.

It sounds like you've been doing your best to cope in the middle of a tough situation. Finding ways to distract yourself can feel like the easiest option when everything is so heavy. What would you like your evenings or nights to feel like instead?

I guess I just want to be able to lay down and actually feel calm, not weighed down by all these thoughts. It’d be nice to fall asleep without overthinking or needing to distract myself. Just some peace for once.

It sounds like having a sense of calm and peace at night is really important to you—a chance to relax and let go of the stress you carry during the day. What do you think might help you begin moving toward that sense of calm?

I really don’t know. Everything I’ve tried feels useless, and honestly, I can’t even imagine being able to quiet my mind. It’s like the stress and the thoughts are always just there, no matter what I do.

It sounds like you've been trying hard to make things better, but it feels like nothing has worked well enough to give you relief. That frustration can make it tough to imagine things improving. Despite it being hard to picture right now, would you say there’s a part of you that still hopes things could get better someday?

Yeah, I guess there’s a part of me that hopes. I just don’t know how to get there, and honestly, it feels exhausting even trying to figure it out. But I do want to sleep better and feel less weighed down—I really do.

It’s clear that you care deeply about finding that calm and improving your sleep, even though it feels exhausting right now. That hope you have, even a small part, is important—it’s a sign that you're wanting something better for yourself. Is there anything more you'd like to talk about regarding the challenges you’ve been facing or where you hope to go from here?
I think that's it for now. Honestly, this was more helpful than I thought it would be. I appreciate you taking the time to listen and talk with me. Thank you.
